channel.title: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~server help! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
channel.description:
HEY thanks for reading my post! ok i host about 8 servers atm using windows XP, and i want to start hosting some more using linux because it takes less memory to run and seems more stable.
Question #1 What version of linux should i use there is: Ubuntu, CentOS, Debian, And Fedora?
Question #2 What Version Of Linux Runs with the least amount of memory on an older computer?
Question #3 What Version of Linux CAN use Java because some Versions cant use java.

item.title: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~server help! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @king-pk king-pk
item.description:
@king-pk wrote:

Yes feel free to contact me for any questions you have. I can even set everything up for you after you attempt in a matter of moments…

pm me your msn.

item.description:
@king-pk wrote:

ubuntu runs java … all linuxs dist run java, yea some handle better then others if configured right ived learned the past few days…

Friendly interface you will get from ubuntu… trust me mate, once you install it just google. “installing java on linux” or something. its all pretty straight forward.

item.title: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~server help! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @king-pk king-pk
item.description:
@king-pk wrote:

try gnome-session

i never used SuSE im currently running Centos and also have a ubuntu side of my HDD

If you are wanting to just play around with it i would suggest downloading ubuntu and installing it aside your windows.

item.title: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~server help! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

WOW THANKS FOR THE HELP

i downloaded SuSE onto a dvd and booted it on my cpu. it seemed to load good once the installation was finished i see a black screen that says grub>. what the heck do i do with this? how do i get to to look like an actual desktop? i type “help” and i got commands but i dont know what do do please help!

Read full topic

item.title: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~server help! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

I’ve been around both Ubuntu and CentOS for limited amounts of time, I still have Ubuntu installed on my computer though for dual booting. I’d say if you’ve never been around Linux systems before to go for the Ubuntu, it’s more user-friendly for people who’ve just came from Windows and from what a friend tells me any Linux can be configured to run as efficiently in the long run.

CentOS is literally all command line from what I seen and can be pretty frustrating if you do not know Linux like the back of your hand. We eventually got things running on centOS but it was definitely a challenge with no prior Linux knowledge and Google was our only savior there, the centOS specific support forums are very slow as well.

Read full topic

item.title: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~server help! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @Dragon_Annihilators Dragon Annihilators
item.description:
@Dragon_Annihilators wrote:

If you order a VPS, do not get OpenVZ - it does not handle java in RAM well and requires at least 2gb of RAM to host a RSCD server due to the block allocation issues.

Read full topic
